intro: Ceroxylon parvum, commonly known as the small wax palm, is a flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. This species is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and a crown of narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spiny fruits. Ceroxylon parvum is often found growing in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations.
